#### Education and Library Services for Springhill Institution
The Correctional Service of Canada is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Education and Library Services at the Springhill Institution.

**Background**
The RFP aims to provide educational and library services to inmates at the Springhill Institution. The service provider will be responsible for delivering educational programs and services that cater to the needs of inmates, particularly those who require rehabilitation and reintegration into society.

**Scope of Work**
The successful bidder will be required to provide the following services:

* Facilitate inmate reintegration by increasing educational skill levels through the provision of accredited programs
* Provide library services similar to those in the community, taking into consideration the requirements of the correctional environment
* Ensure education programs and services respect gender, ethnic, cultural, and linguistic differences and are responsive to the special needs of women inmates, Indigenous inmates, inmates requiring mental health care, and other groups

**Objectives**
The objectives of the RFP are to provide educational and library services that meet the needs of inmates at the Springhill Institution, in line with the Correctional Service of Canada's policies and guidelines.

**Evaluation Criteria**
The evaluation criteria for this RFP will focus on the bidder's ability to deliver high-quality educational and library services that meet the needs of inmates. The evaluation will consider the bidder's experience, qualifications, and capacity to provide services that are responsive to the needs of inmates.

**Timeline**
The successful bidder will be required to provide services from March 1, 2023 to March 31, 2024, with an option to renew for an additional one-year period.

**Contact Information**
For more information, please contact Matthew Couture, Contracting Authority, at matthew.couture@csc-scc.gc.ca or 506-378-8730.

**Documents**
The complete RFP document and evaluation criteria can be found on the [Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](https://buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders) website.

**Note to Bidders**
The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process. Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada.
